    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyGenerationManager

        public KeyGenerationManager(int keySize,
                    int amountAlpha,
                    int amountNumeric,
                    int amountSpecial)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        This Constructor defines a specific key. The sum of amountAlpha, amountNumeric and amountSpecial has to be the keySize. The keySize has to be a 128 Bit -Key. It is defined in the AES- Standard. The keySize is a Byte- Size, so it's not allowed to use a value over 16.
        Example
        Valid Constructor: Size = 16, amountAlpha = 10, amountNumeric = 3, amountSpecial = 3 Valid Constructor, too: Size = 12, amountAlpha = 6, amountNumeric = 3, amountSpecial = 3
        Invalid Constructor: Size = 32, amountAlpha = 20, amountNumeric = 10, amountSpecial = 2
        Parameters:
        keySize - - defines the size of the key. The AES- Standard defines the value to 128Bit
        amountAlpha - - defines the size of the alphabetic quota of the keySize
        amountNumeric- - defines the size of the numeric quota of the keySize
        amountSpecial - - defines the size of the special characters quota of the keySize
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • KeyGenerationManager

        public KeyGenerationManager()
        This Constructor defines a default key. The sum of amountAlpha, amountNumeric and amountSpecial has to be the keySize. The keySize has to be a 128 Bit -Key. It is defined in the AES- Standard. The keySize is a Byte- Size, so it's not allowed to use a value over 16. The default key will have the following settings:
      • KeySize = 16
      • Size of the alphabetic quota = 8
      • Size of the numeric quota = 4
      • Size of the special characters quota = 4

  • Method Detail

      public void generateAndStoreKey()

      public java.security.Key readSecretKey(java.lang.String pathOfKey)
      This method returns the secret key
      Returns:
      - returns the generated secret key
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException - if the Path is empty or the File does not exist

    • readSecretKey

      public java.security.Key readSecretKey()
      This method returns the secret key
      Returns:
      - returns the generated secret key from the default-path
